page.title: 05Medical,Wick
page.content: The Town and County Hospital was originally built as a hospital for fever patients,but now provides long-term care for up to twenty-eight elderly patients and ten surgical convalescent patients. The elderly patients, who are encouraged to spend weekends with their families wherever possible, are cared for by 26 trained staff of whom 6 are part-time.In 1986 a new hospital is to open in Wick which will cater for all medical, surgical and maternity cases and will also provide long-term care for the elderly.It has been proposed that the new hospital will be called the Caithness General Hospital.The Town and County Hospital will then probably be surplus to requirements but may provide a site for new staff homes.
